segments.text: I notice the woman is so focused on drying that plate, like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just cascading down the cabinets, and she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching into the cookie jar, and I can’t help but smile at his determination.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is watching him with such anticipation, like she’s about to get the best treat ever.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the stool is going to tip, and he’s going to fall right into that puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light from the window makes the whole scene feel so peaceful, even though it’s not.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how much water is on the floor now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s apron is so neat, but everything around her is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s plate is ready to catch cookies, but I hope he doesn’t drop it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice the water or the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so perfect, like nothing bad could ever happen there.
segments.speaker: PAR
